description: FINALLY 7TH DEADLY SIN ENVY IS COMPLETE Now because this was soo long awaited, I find myself feeling quiet nervous about how you all think. The 7 deadly sin project was something I didnt expect to become quiet so popular *as it did* and I have received notes after notes of people requesting I finish the project and asking where is the 7th sin?- Well here she is finally I hope it does not look too rushed *as it was not, but I feel it has very little detail in it as some of the other additions to the project, but let me tell you, THIS was NOT a half hearted job!* so hopefully you guys like it, for this is probably the first image I have ever drawn due to so much request for it to be completed by the public. This sin is ENVY, I had a hard time trying to decide what characters to use for this last deadly sin. The project as many know was based around the tradish Alice in wonderland Disney movie. But it is really based on all the Alice in wonderland stories But mixing it up and making it abit my own. I chose to use ALICE in the last sin because she was the main character and although I used her in a few of the other sins, she never really had the spot light. So I thought it would be silly not having her own part when wonderland is ALL about Alice Here I presented Alice as a pretty wreckless teen maybe? Split personality The Alice on the right is the Alice venturing down to wonderland The other is straight Alice in what would be considered real time Alice. Alice envies herself? Envies the Alice that is in wonderland. I know that my version is a little trippy and hard to make sense of, but I got a lot of inspiration from the American mcgee alice, girl interrupted. And of course the ORIGONAL story and the person who actually wrote it She is surrounded by flowers *remember the flowers in the movie?* I was going to present this with wonderland Alice crying out to real time sleeping Alice outside the door, and I do know its not really envy more maybe panic and trauma  so I tweaked my ideas a little. Anyway I hope this satisfies. If I could I probably would redo this project and do it all differently but shrugs- And now, the 7 deadly sins are complete. I had a lot of fun working thought and completing it. Originals all drawn on A3 paper. All will be available for print Enjoy guys Tegan Coddington. -pride [link] -greed [link] -gluttony [link] -sloth [link] -lust [link] -wrath [link]

description: Oil paint on canvas - 80x120 cm. Bizarrely, that word .. Luxuriance... had been running in my head for days like an intriguing leitmotiv, and painting it out seemed the most natural and only way to shut the voice. Here is a painting I finished in january after 3 months of daily efforts. I've forced myself to paint everyday, despite the usual overwork at 2Roqs. For once this painting isn't about a deep worry I may have had, it is more simple in the meaning. Instead, I've explored domains quite new to me: for instance, I've plunged almost the whole painting into penumbra to allow a brighter light to fall down on the hand. I worked out the movement and the body language. The weird cropping of the girl should produce a disequilibrium that contradicts her course. On her face, I tried to display an expression of joyful surprise mixed with a bit of worry. Close-ups can be seen at zancan.fr. I hope you like green!

description: LUST of my seven deadly sins project using Alice in wonderland inspirations IS complete! I did promise to work on these while I was on holiday, so here you are. I chose to do Alice lusting over the white rabbit, yes quiet a different approach.. She desires to know what he is late forand where he is going! i dont really love this one all that much...it is ok but i feel i could have created it better... although it did take loads of work and time i just think its my least fav of the sins i have done so far. I didnt mean to make it look much like my latest submission to the seven deadly sins project sloth [link] using the tree and all that it just came to mind when creating the white rabbit. I adore how I did the white rabbit; please take a FULL VIEW on this one. I also added in cog looking things around the banner at the bottom kinda symbolising the white rabbits pocket watch, when it got smashed to bits by the mad hatter and the mad hare in the Alice in Wonderland Disney movie. I chose to do this red in colour like my pride piece because it is lust after all.. And I dont mind using the same kind of colours over again. Drawn in Faber castel watercolour pencils no water added. Ink and lead pencils.. Ok I hope you enjoy this! Im just glad it to be finished! ps... this is a poem written by ~dontkillthellama, it really fits this image! i like how she had captured my artwrok well and given it some extra quirk with her writings!! check it out ---> [link] Pride [link] Greed [link] Gluttony [link] Sloth [link]

description: Gouache on black cardboard. Does anyone have good tips on how to mix gouache? To me it takes forever to hit the right colors because I'm trying to keep the jars the paint from clean from the brushes in my current use. So far the best solution I have is to use a regular knife to carve out pure color bits to mix on the palette because it's easier to clean with a napkin than a brush is. Gouache has a tricky way of blending only when the color activates after a little rubbing. I painted the clouds in this one 4 times over to get enough color to build up on the background layers. I was travelling around Finland during xmas and at first I thought carrying around 4 kilos of paint on top of the presents I had for family was a bit excessive. But then when it got a bit too much I huddled together with my black sketchbook and enormous amounts of wine and painted this. It was the exact escape I needed. I hope you all survived the holidays in one piece

description: This was my design for my 2008 holiday card. So many people liked my 2006 card, and I had such fun making it, that I thought it would be fun to re-visit the idea. The final illustration measures 10" x 14" and was painted with acrylic paint on Bristol board. The snow was added later in Photoshop, using an inverted ink splatter that I made and scanned for this purpose. So the image is still mostly traditionally done, but with some post-production stuff handled in Photoshop. Completed in December of 2008. Prints of this illustration are now available!

description: It's time for more original work for the con. I'm digging into my stacks of old paper. What to say about this.... It's another member of my disappearing dragon series. The paper was made years ago with textile ink, leaves (to make the pattern) and salt. My visual idea was to have a creature (creatures) breaking a liquid surface, and to use an opaque paint to signify form above the water, and move to a transparent medium when addressing objects beneath the water. The result was very successful (and I should like to try it again) but the paper fought me all the way. Salt has a tendency to get into the fibers and disrupt paint, especially watery paint. The salt was accidental. The paper had absorbed it from some other paper sitting in the pile. But well, these things happen, and it turned out well regardless. I wish I could work a bit more on it, but the convention looms, and I need to get onto other things. I'll price it high, and if I bring it home, I'll work on it some more. Thanks everyone who looks/faves/comments :3

The reason I said it's longest because I have the concept for few years but it always drops. It drops not because I stop draw but everytime I draw half of piece, I have new concept of that animal so I start again (the circle repeats at least 4 times ). But anyway, this is one of the piece done. I am sorry I can't make them finish to make new calendar as I promised with someone 3 years ago (I know, I am such a super slow worker ;A; ). ----------------------------------------------------- More and more, not only polar bears are dying day by day because of the Global Warming & other reasons. I guess I don't have to say much about it. Please feel it yourselves. description: Traditional drawing of Jensen Ackles. Finally I started watching the tv series "Supernatural" (I finished season 2) and it's great so far. I really like the character "Dean" (played by Jensen Ackles), because he's funny, so I decided to draw him. But it's a bit strange for me, because a few days ago I noticed that I had a poster of him on my wall ~13 years ago (I totally forgot that he was in "Dark Angel", too)... At first I thought it would be more difficult to draw the water, but in the end it was fun. The most difficult part was the likeness and the "paper" (I'm still saving my last sheets and looking for a replacement for my favourite drawing paper, but maybe I should've used the good paper for this drawing instead of the grainier no name paper). Reference was a picture from a photoshoot (Michael Muller 2006?). Paper DIN A4 190g/m²; Faber-Castell Polychromos artists' colour pencils, Copic Ciao and Sketch marker, uni-ball Signo pigment ink um-153 white; time: ~20 hours Please don't upload my pictures somewhere else without my permission. Don't infringe copyright! Here are some other traditional drawings:

description: There is a legend about beast called Tupilak at the End of World. At the End of World, there is an endless conflict of Lightbringers and Darknesbringers- however, that keeps the world in right balance of Dark and Light. A Light cannot shine without Darkness. Tupilak, the black pitch, who is running around the world by summoning Darknessbringers- monstruos alcoholic-smoke shaped massive cloudy mass- from this materia monsters are shaped out begin based on real life creatures. When the world is plunged into darkness, the Lightbringers are coming and bringing a divine light to clean darkness away which Tupilak left. Both beasts are chasing each endlessly running around the world. Tupilak's massive dark cloudy mass has many thousands (pierwiastek), atoms and reactions- it's said it has spacial materia and incredibly strong reactions and it may explode on massive scale. Sciencists are really crazy on it.... Wanted to paint something personal and experiment a bit with more watercolors. That was so fun but really hard to draw- and I really like how it came. In couple past days I did so many crazy chemistry experiments and that painted paper I liked for the most. I found.. that expensive and awesum quality watercolor papers with neat texture really SUCKS because alcohol reactions are NOT working! The best are.. simply printer papers and hardstock smooth papers which I got- are amazing for reactions. For example, there is no green here. I mixed black with olive green, so I had greyish black. Painted base and did some weird reactions with water and ethanol so it *sepreated* that mixture into two seperate colours- black and green! Funny effect. Ah and this picture is an opposite to Lightbringers. That fragment and concepts will be used in our story.
title: Darkness Bringers Exileden Watch Traditional Art Drawings Fantasy Exileden

description: Ariadne, Whose name means 'The Utterly Pure', is the Cretan Mistress of the Labyrinth. In later Greek myth She is depicted as a mortal princess, but it's pretty clear Her origins are divine. In the Greek legend She was the daughter of King Minos of Crete; Her half-brother was the monstrous half-man, half-bull Minotaur imprisoned within the labyrinth. When Theseus came, as part of the tribute of youths and maidens fed to the monster, She fell in love with him and helped him to defeat the Minotaur, in part by giving him a ball of string to unwind and then rewind so he could find his way back. Theseus, being a git, abandoned Her the first chance he got; but here Her divine origins shine through a bit, as the God Dionysos then found Her and fell in love with Her, and They were married. She was, most likely, already His wife. As a Goddess then Ariadne has Underworld and even shamanic attributes, as the labyrinth represents the journey into the dark and the subsequent return to the light. She is also associated with stars; the constellation of the Corona Borealis is said to have been Her marriage crown. (This constellation is also associated with the Welsh Goddess Arianrhod.) The Minotaur was also sometimes known by the name Asterios, meaning Star. I have shown Her here untangling the ball of thread with which the labyrinth is navigated.

description: Finally finished my 7 deadly sins wrath- And I have to say I am very pleased with the finished result! I am very excited but Im sure not as excited as Carie Wilson of South Africa, this young 15-16 year old girl is having a ball taking credit for my 7 deadly sins with Alice in wonderland inspirations at her school and in art class, amongst other creations of mine Im sure Im sure she will be delighted to see the 6th edition to my almost finished 7 deadly sin project smiles- Im just glad I can work my butt of for pathetic little children like you to come by and steal my work. I am aware your probably not the only one but lets take this message as something to send to any of you who steal work that is not your own *you can do what you want and run this roller coaster ride as fun as it is living a lie and pretending to be something your not, the truth will soon come out and if not you will always know what you did is wrong and how many people you lied to*. I hope stealing others work fulfils your little bellies for how ever long before it rots away, your head will never get rid of the truth. Better hope no one finds out about your icky little lies how embarrassing will that be! -smiles- anyway I chose to use the caterpillar as wrath because he had a very short temper in Alice in wonderland  he was very sloth- full too but lost his temper at Alice and blew a lot of smoke in her face robably got her a bit high Of corse we all know that the caterpillar in Alice in wonderland is in fact blue but I chose to do each sin in colour tones to create interesting and different looking work *if you didnt know* colour toning for each sin also gives me the chance to express each sin with a perfect matching colour along with the matching character of Alice in wonderland for each sin. I used yellows, oranges and pinkie red colours for something a little different with this one, I would have steered away from using more red *because I have so in two sins already* but the stoned caterpillar does blow red smoke at Alice when he got mad *in the Alice in wonderland Disney movie* I had to use red ^_^ I am pretty surprised that I feel I made this image look quiet nice considering how Im starting to get real sick and tired of this project and I do not like oranges and yellows super doper muchI do hate to feel like Im ever rushing a piece just for the sake of getting it done! Rushing work always shows as does lack of passion -Shrugs- ill let you guys decide PS. I had quiet defined stripes of red in the mushroom the caterpillar is sitting onand his smoke was much more detailed, filled with skull faces and swirls that dont show up so good through the scanner Trouble with reds again Utensils used, Faber castel watercolour pencils no added water Black Ink. poem by dontkillthellama, [link] -view my other complete sins below, one more to go!! Pride [link] Greed [link] Gluttony [link] Sloth [link] Lust [link]

description: A piece for a group show at Gallery 1988: Venice. The show is a called "The Road to Shermer" a tribute show to the movies of John Hughes. You know, classic teen movies from the '80s. I chose Ferris Bueller's Day Off as it's the John Hughes film that had greatest impact on me back in the day. ***There are plot spoilers that follow if you somehow haven't seen this movie, you've been warned.*** After re-watching the film and contemplating a bit, the thought occurred to me that it is not really about Ferris Bueller. It's about Cameron Frye, Ferris's uptight best friend with a miserable home life and a lot of fears. Through the course of the film, Ferris doesn't change or grow, nor do any characters except for Cameron (and, to a lesser degree, Ferris's sister). Ferris acts as the catalyst by which Cameron is forced to confront those fears and (at least in his mind) overcomes them. The pivotal point of the film is the scene where Cameron throws himself into the pool. This is the only time in the story where Ferris seems to express real concern and emotion for anything. It's as if in this world, everything is a joke or a game, except this moment when Cameron's life is truly in question. Cameron is symbolically 'reborn' as he emerges from the pool to a new awareness that will allow him to deal with his father's anger in regards to his prized car. Cameron is the character in the movie I think most people can identify with and his 'redemption' seems the most compelling arch of the story. Anyway, here's what came of it. If you know the movie, you should get most of the different symbols I threw in the piece.
title: The Rebirth of Cameron Frye jasinski Watch Traditional Art Paintings Surreal jasinski

description: This painting was done in watercolors and modified in Photoshop. It is the third in my Zodiac series, this one is for Cancer. I was really tempted to call it the Cranken in reference to the Cracken of Roman myth... but then decided only I probably thought that would be humorous, so I settled on the more romantic name. The trend is going to be mermaids for the water signs. I'm planning to do a male and a female of each sign, and quite possibly using the alternate symbols for each sign, for instance Scorpio's negative qualities are supposed to be the scorpion and positive qualities are the eagle... or so I've been told... in any case I see some research in my future. description: Cute Redhead - Ballpoint Pen on paper. The pigment pheomelanin gives red hair its distinctive color. Red hair has far more of the pigment pheomelanin than it has of the dark pigment eumelanin. The genetics of red hair, discovered in 1997, appear to be associated with the melanocortin-1 receptor (MC1R), which is found on chromosome 16. Red hair is associated with fair skin color because of low concentrations of eumelanin throughout the body of those with red hair. This lower melanin-concentration confers the advantage that a sufficient concentration of important Vitamin D can be produced under low light conditions. However, when UV-radiation is strong (as in regions close to the equator) the lower concentration of melanin leads to several medical disadvantages, such as a higher risk of skin cancer. The alleles Arg151Cys, Arg160Trp, Asp294His, and Arg142His on MC1R are shown to be recessives for the red hair phenotype. The gene HCL2 (also called RHC or RHA) on chromosome 4 may also be related to red hair. Red hair is the rarest natural hair color in humans. The non-tanning skin associated with red hair may have been advantageous in far-northern climates where sunlight is scarce. Studies by Bodmer and Cavalli-Sforza (1976) hypothesized that lighter skin pigmentation prevents rickets in colder climates by encouraging higher levels of Vitamin D production and also allows the individual to retain heat better than someone with darker skin. In 2000, Harding et al. concluded that red hair was not the result of positive selection and instead proposed that it occurs because of a lack of negative selection. In Africa, for example, red hair is selected against because high levels of sun would be harmful to untanned skin. However, in Northern Europe this does not happen, so redheads come about through genetic drift. Estimates on the original occurrence of the currently active gene for red hair vary from 20,000 to 100,000 years ago. A DNA study has concluded that some Neanderthals also had red hair, although the mutation responsible for this differs from that which causes red hair in modern humans. Took aprox. 60 hours to finish. Lost about 30% quality during scanning. The size is 8" x 7,5" or 20cm x 19cm. description: My piece for ~Illustrationshare 's contest for "Illustrate a Story". This is taken from the tale of the same title, written by Oscar Wilde. The plot of this tragic story is that a young man wishes to dance with the love of his life...but she will only dance with him if he gives her a red rose. But it's the dead of winter, so it's impossible. The nightingale, who wants him to be happy and in love, decides to help him find a rose. However, she learns that the only way to make one grow is to pierce her heart on the rose bush's thorn, to make a red rose bloom out of love and blood. She dies, and the young man plucks the rose to give to his lady love. She spurns the gift, which took such a tremendous sacrifice, because it doesn't match her dress. Yeah. Pens on bristol, with colors in Photoshop 7. This picture was featured in Vanity Fair Italy --> [link]

description: I have only had to enter the words (pencil) after a title once before, that was for my drawing 'Running Water' When I finished this drawing I felt the same way that I did when I finished that one, apart from completely exhausted, I actually liked what I saw in front of me and wanted to make sure people knew that it was drawn with a pencil rather than digital. This was my most difficult, intense and tiring drawing. Taking over 60 hours to complete, I used only one pencil - my 0.5mm mechanical 4B pencil, why? I guess I was really lazy and didn't want to change pencils every 2 minutes - if I had It would have taken twice as long! it was also good practise in applying varying amounts of pressure to get different effects, rather than using various grades of pencil. My other friend's on creating this were my blending stump, "Tombo Mono Zero' eraser and little brush to keep the rubbings off the paper Drawn on locally sourced smooth paper, dimensions - 70cm X 40cm. UPDATE I have just uploaded a Montage of photos taken throughout the drawing of 'Water Dragon' you can see it by clicking the thumbnail below

description: Well I was drawen all in ballpoint pens and done in about 8 hours I recon, Im not intiredly sure cause I stopped and started so much I couldnt really tell. The idea behind it was to do with the whole club cult thats taking over that kind of cyber fetish. Always loved the sign for toxic waste so thats what I wanted it to be more about. the pose is taken from a photo with alot of alterations in colour and accesories but thats how I get the shape of the face and the shading done. The best ball point pens I've found to date is a pack of 10 from Tesco for 39p check them out and the 1.49 pack of 9 are good as well for darker colours, for black ones always use bic and steadler colours are fantastic too.

description: So this is gluttony number three of my seven deadly sins using alice in wonderland inspirations. I have always thought that there was something sinister about tweedle dee and tweedle dumyou shouldnt be fooled with their wide grins and moral teaching stoiresThey have something off hidden behind their narrow eyes I chose tweedle dee and tweedle dum for gluttony because they were rather chubby in the cartoon and I just always got a weird sense of the fact they lingered around in a forest waiting for straying little girls my version of tweedle dee and tweedle dum are quiet strange and not so nice I can almost hear them munching old bones by looking at their faces I could have easily done the walrus and the carpenter for gluttony, mainly the walrus because he ate all the oysters *this is a story tweedle dee and tweedle dum told alice* But I simply did not want to do that This image is by far my least favourite and only because Im not huge into the design or characters I used in this one I do enjoy what Ive done but out of the three Ive done so far it was the one I just wanted to get out of the way. I chose blues and purples for this because I simply wanted to, was originally going to make it pinkish for gluttony but it didnt make tweedle dee and tweedle dum look quiet as menacing. Utensils used were water colour faber castells *no water added* Ink and fine liner pens. Xoxo enjoy ps click here [link] to see another poem from the lovely ~dontkillthellama... she really adds to my art with her words. pride [link] greed [link]

description: White Stag as Totem The white stag (a deer that is albino or leucistic) is a sacred creature both now, and in ancient Indo-European societies. It was considered a messenger from the otherworld, and was an animal considered mythologically difficult to capture - or impossible to capture. Much of the folklore around the white stag and hart focus on hunting or capturing it, and as such, I tend to see an element of sacrifice and the nature of the hunt embodied in this animal - hence the glyph focusing on the speared heart. - Original available for sale - on hold 18.5 x 20.5cm (or 7.4 x 8 in) illo's board, fineliner, aquarelle, pencil, metallic and iridescent paint

description: Toxic Poison Tea Party Finally yet another post Its been disappointing how rarely Ive been able to sit down and draw a nice new picture, Ive got a scrap book full of little sketches of art to be done and this is one of them in its finalized state *phew* I might post up the pages of sketches I do for some of these art pieces its amusing to see how artists come up with their ideas and how a stick figure surrounded in crosses and a few lines represents this image in its quick development stage ..well at least I found it amusing sulks- At work we had put a wedding cake together *thats my job* with apple green ribbon with black centre black and green is very sexy together and drawing images of one colour are so fun to do yet easier than others Trying to figure out what colour to do where kinda sucks So thats where the idea arose *black and green ..mmm yummy* I love my idea of the spilling tea cups and the bunnies dancing around They are different from my spastic bunnies I almost saw this image in a dream and the bunnies where kind of normal/nice looking and almost plane ..like in a fairy-tail book. I like how the bunnies and certain things are not very even looking dancing around her ..nor do they all look the same Its a bit wrinkled at parts because of the ink I used to colour the background.. I would rather had used pencils throughout but what waste of the beloved black pencil and all my texters/markers start to choke if I use them an awful lot But wrinkles is what you get and I guess I was too impatent to flatten it for a week before I posted it here *pokes tongue* so dont complain! PLEASE FULL VIEW What inspired me? My dreams, Everything here Ive grown from my own head .. Used some lithium picnic fetish photography for the girls appearance in facial features. I support originality UTENSILS faber castel watercolours, sharpie markers, lead pencils, ink and fine liners.

description: This whole image was inspired by one of my crazy mind throughs Imagine if people where born with their life partner?!... Imagine if something about it made it all rightthey could reproduce their own young when old enough without any incest problems Somehow born in the same womb yet not genetically alike in any way Except for the fact that they where born to be together perfect for one another. Everyone would have two children at once *ouch* one boy and one girlor two same sex if thats the way they swing ..all born with one thing certain, that they where going to spend the rest of their lives together as partners. If the world was like this no one would ever miss out on feeling love like the millions of people who do today, everyone would get that special feeling and that chance to feel a bond and closeness to someone so deeply as you do when you find yourself in love. No body would be lonely ever again,imagine how happy and content the world would be if everyone was just with someone *born with a partner* Someone to talk to and share things with Of corse this would not be the end of all our world problemsbut imagine if things where this way we wouldnt know any different. Perfectly normal *just the way its meant to be* imagine how different the place would be. So with all that said I drew this The man and woman adults would have been born together once too and are now bringing their own little to be *wife and husband* into the world make any sense? Hhaha- it might seem weird and gross but if it was the way the world worked all the time we just wouldnt know any different The man and woman have both got limbs missing maybe to link them together since the idea is that they where born together as life partners I think this is a very powerful love and bonding piece The couple look so in love and Ive made their world look a little odd and twisted to our eyes, because to most of you this probably seems way too strange to comprehend. look for the Cheshire cat and evil looking white rabbit amongst the gloom Ive given it *Alice in wonderland* characteristics since this image developed from my wondering  this is My little wonderland hence the name I called it. The baby girl with the ribbon in her hair is holding hands with the baby boy, butterflies surround them. utensils used Faber castel watercolour pencils *no water added* Drawn on A3 sized paper like everything I draw- Ink and Photoshop brushes. Everything involved in this pic is pretty much my own.. The heart and the bat wings inspired from a necklace I made and human features created by my own imagination. Xoxoxox Thankyou. Enjoy. Tegan Coddington.

description: Young Warrior (Húrin) Galdor and Hareth had two sons, Húrin and Huor. Húrin was by three years the elder, but he was shorter in stature than other men of his kin; in this he took after his mother's people, but in all else he was like Hador his grandfather, fair of face and golden-haired, strong in body and fiery of mood. But the fire in him burned steadily, and he had great endurance of will. Of all Men of the North he knew most of the counsels of the Noldor. -- J. R. R. Tolkien: Unfinished Tales, Narn i Hîn Húrin, The Childhood of Túrin This was a pencil drawing that I started doodling in a meeting a couple of weeks ago with no idea what it would turn into.. I just started to draw a face study, decided to make it male, then a warrior.. and this happened. I didnt plan it to be a portrait initially, but after detailing the face I thought he fit my image of young Húrin, so I finished the drawing with this thought in mind. Húrin was the greatest warrior among mortal Men, his strength in arms matched only by his unbreakable will that earned him the epessë Thalion, Steadfast. Cursed by Morgoth, his fate, and that of his family, became the most tragic tale among the Edain in the Elder Days. He is shown here a couple of years after his return from Gondolin, before he had married Morwen or taken up the lordship of Dor-lómin and the House of Hador at the death of his father. It could be around FA 460, which would make him some twenty years old  not yet come to full manhood, but already a fighter hardened by many battles. He leans on his trusty axe and wears a fine coat of dwarf-mail. HB and 5B pencils + the usual Photoshop deal.

description: Well, I figured it was time to do an illustration for my absolute, all-time, favorite book: 'Winter's Tale' by Mark Helprin. If you're into magical realism, you should check it out - it's truly a beautiful and wonderful read. Not to go into too much detail, but this is the scene when Athansor, Peter Lake's flying white horse, rises from the sea with a young Christiana on his back. I was (again) trying for Arthur Rackham's style - I'm mostly happy. I can't really accomplish the layers and layers of tinting that make his works so great, but I try

description: 2006 420mm—297mm water color Thank you for the comment. I'm sorry for giving a false impression by the insufficient explanation moreover. This work is not a picture along the original of Lewis Carrol though the title is "Alice". There is often using Alice's motif for an original work in Japan. Alice's world is translated as a meaning of "It is lovely", "Mystery", "Girl's world", and "Fantasy" often. We obtain the idea from Alice's world, conceive freely while using those meanings, and express the work. One of the themes of my picture is "The adult is a mature child. " though it is not only this picture. The figure subject that I draw contains all the following meanings. --- adult,Chilrd,woman,man,me,you --- In a word, human being. Because this picture is one of the pictures drawn after that manner, the drawn person is not girl. The undergarment was not drawn because it is an expression of not the expression of a sexual thing but a mature child. Moreover, it is neither a girl it is nor a boy. Either element that was able to be specified was lost because it drew as an asexuality. For instance, skirt. Therefore, I think that I should not restrict this picture as "Sexual picture". And, the child and the adult come to the gallery and this picture can be seen actually. It is possible to buy it. It is a strange thing that the thing that can be freely seen by the real world is restricted in the world of the net. The expression should be free. If you read this, and understanding of this picture deepens, I am glad. Thanks.

description: Another experiment with the watercolor. Ah.. not as successful as the others, but I don't mind. My very first drawing teacher in college (Actually, I think he was my second) used to have a drawing professor who told his students to 'ush a drawing until it breaks' or in other words, work at it until you've overworked it to learn when to stop, or to learn as much as you can from a practice piece. I might have done that. I don't know. I made a few bad decisions, but hopefully I've learned from them. The markings look eerily like Link's wolf form from the latest Zelda game. At least, I think so. I've never played it, but that's what they remind me of : / Edit: OK, my sweets, I went back and fiddled with the picture and fixed some of the problems that I and other people agreed upon. But I am really tired of fooling with this thing, so please no more suggestions. They would just make me weep D: Thanks XD

description: This is the second piece for the series of artwork based on North American wildlife and Native American craft and culture (for a better description, see Sacred Ceremony. A grey wolf smokes his handcrafted totem pipe. The wolf head on the pipe is inspired by a wooden carving that I own myself. The composition came out nicely, yet I find that I may have gone a little too dark again especially on the ears and muzzle. As about the picture itself, I actually hand a pose reference for the the human but the egret is 100% original. This is just a sketch I did on paper with pencil and pen and edited in Photoshop. If I have time, I might actually put more work into it and color it like real drawing should be colored.

description: The sister (arf) piece to this one, featuring yours truly with the devil himself, can be found here: [link] A Christmas present for my sister, whose name is Beth, the temptation to call this Beth and Death almost overcame me. But she'd probably kick my butt for that. Besides which, I rather like Death Becomes Her. So the gorgeous being you see in this picture is.... the Grim Reaper... *giggles* sorry sis.... Nah, that's my too-pretty-by-far sister pulling off her Botticelli's venus pose, a picture I swore I would make good use of, and so I have. And just for those of you who think I've lost the plot shoving the Grim Reaper behind my sister, she actually has a 'thing' for him, so she liked it. Kinda like putting Satan with a gun behind me. Yummy. I'm really really happy with this picture, probably my best to date with coloured pencil, if only for the fact it does look like my sister. There are a couple of things I might change given the chance, but I don't feel they detract from the picture *gaspcoughshock*. Now then, if only ol' Grimmy and Lucifer would happen along looking for a couple of willing dates.... ________ Karisma pencils on grey card, © Zephyri, 2004. Time taken: a couple of demon-driven nights right before christmas, probably about ten-fifteen hours.

description: ?????????. Erpeton tentaculum. Another example of the many rather freakish snakes that Thailand houses is the aptly named Tentacled Snake, with its give-away feature of a twin pair of "tentacles" attached to its snout. For the longest of time, no one could say for sure what these tentacles were for, but latest studies may suggest them to be highly mechanosensory detectors for sensing prey in murky water. Another fascinating feature is the way it hunts its main prey: Triggering the Mauthner Neuron of fish which reacts to pressure waves (which, in fish, causes a reflex to quickly move away), the snake basically fools its prey, leading it right into its mouth. Being rear-fangend, it possesses a mild venom that humans don't have to fear - the same can't be said for fish, though. See it's sneaky hunting strategy in action here: www.youtube.com/watch?v=hP7b8q… Personal anecdote: Years back at a local snake farm in Thailand, the snake keepers were so impressed by my enthusiasm and absolute lack of fear regarding snakes (i was a little kid back then and most kids would do after their parents and naturally go all "eewww!" when exposed to these things) that one of them would lead me to a water jar, grab a pair of these Tentacled Snakes and put them right into my hand. I was so in love that i'd keep them for God knows how long. The snake keeper wanted to give them to me as a present, "take them!" And i so would have done that - if it wasn't for my mother. Who said NO.

description: Oil painting on canvas - 81x100cm ( 32x40" ) It is only a forest. In the first place I met this painting in a book, thus it was fair to place a book in the painting. It owes its title to a protagonist of this novel, though the latter is only an alibi. For the first time there is no character in it. However, the painting is far from being anonymous. In front of the blank canvas, it's difficult to know were exactly we're aiming at. We need to write the pages, we have to work our way. One can learn a lot about oneself by painting a forest. So this is a canvas that I've start in March and finished in December ( with a number of gaps in between, unfortunately ). After drifting toward warmer tones, urban material and a more contemporary feel in my works, at one point I felt this retrograde impulse to immerse into the lush again, and to make that dive alone. It was shortly after a two-months period when I invested my time in the frantic, yet unproductive job of organizing an exhibition in a gallery near home. Quite naturally this painting shows a path which is more driven toward the inside. I was expecting it to look peaceful and bright, but it turned out rather dark ( and obsessive, and stiff with some twists, but that's how far self-analysis will go ; ) ). Note that no reference was used here _ this forest is purely fantasized. You can watch some close ups on the canvas >here<. I will also try to make a video montage of the painting at its various stages, since I have been taking photographs of it all the way through! (if i find time, knowing the man it could take a while ) Cheerrzzzzzz !

description: Horse Head - Ballpoint Pen on paper. This is my first drawing of a horse head with Ballpoint Pen. Commissioned for a book cover. The horse (Equus ferus caballus) is one of two extant subspecies of Equus ferus. It is an odd-toed ungulate mammal belonging to the taxonomic family Equidae. The horse has evolved over the past 45 to 55 million years from a small multi-toed creature into the large, single-toed animal of today. Humans began to domesticate horses around 4000 BC, and their domestication is believed to have been widespread by 3000 BC. Horses in the subspecies caballus are domesticated, although some domesticated populations live in the wild as feral horses. These feral populations are not true wild horses, as this term is used to describe horses that have never been domesticated, such as the endangered Przewalski's horse, a separate subspecies, and the only remaining true wild horse. Took aprox. 60 hours to finish over a period of 60 days. Lost about 30% quality during scanning. The size is 90% of a standard A4 sheet. Thank you for faving and watching. » FACEBOOK « | » PRINTS « Due to thousands of questions and my lack of time to answer them all here are the answers for the most frequently asked: » FAQ « | More like this from me: Materials: 2 Bic Cristal Pocket Scents colored ballpoint pens and mostly Classic black Bic ballpoint pen on 300g/m2 A2 smooth paper. description: [link] Hurt (c) Trent Reznor EDIT: Alright, after the tenth "No, its from Johnny Cash! etc"-comment, i'm fed up to the back teeth. So, for everyone: NO. Johnny Cash did NOT come up with this song. He was the one who covered it and made it popular. Trent Reznor wrote it, first appearing on the concept album by Nine Inch Nails called "The Downward Spiral". Now, i'm also not one of those NIN-fanatics who curse the Cash version. I like both versions, actually. And only a fool will try to compare them both, because you simply can't. The version of Cash transfers the nostalgic pain of an old man looking back to a long life full of experiences one can only imagine, putting this kind of wise farewell to the words. In contrast, Reznors version describes the hopelessness and agony of a young but already destroyed soul whose way in life went to a wrong direction, depicting the deepest that you can fall into while suffering from a fatal depression. It is the end of a downward spiral. No offence. But i'm tired of people who always seem to feel urged to compare these two.

description: © Ben Heine || Facebook || Twitter || www.benheine.com ____________________________________________________ Yes we can have a dream. This is a watercolor painting I made some 9 months before Barack Obama was elected President of the United States the 4th of November 2008 (I uploaded it on DA the 2nd of April 2008). ____________________________________________________ For more information about my artwork: info@benheine.com ____________________________________________________ Some of my other Obama portraits: Yes we can A poem by Peter S. Quinn Yes we can When it comes tomorrow Yes we can We have no time to borrow Just understand Closeness to love’s heart Is all at our command This heart is made to cure And set up dreams come true Take away time’s insecure And make some time for you Don’t let this heart now cry With timeless falling rain Or love from it say goodbye Because its love was in pain Yes we can When it comes tomorrow Yes we can We have no time to borrow… All is happening right now To offer new peace its try Making it together somehow Wherever true affluence lie Yes this we must all work on To discover lives ingenuous gift Before our conducts is gone Into days of desperate shift Yes we can When it comes tomorrow Yes we can We have no time to borrow Just understand Closeness to love’s heart Is all at our command... (The poem appeared on www.poemhunter.com/peter-s-qui… -------------------- Martin Luther King "dream" lives on, 40 years after death By AFP WASHINGTON -- On April 4 America marks the 40th anniversary of the assassination of Martin Luther King, just as the first black candidate with a viable shot at the White House reinvigorates the late reverend's civil rights "dream." In 1968 the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr was killed by a single bullet to the head while on the balcony of the Lorraine Motel in downtown Memphis, in the southern state of Tennessee. The Nobel peace prize winner was just 39 years old. Had he lived he would have turned 79 in January. The mystery surrounding his assassination has swirled for years, with escaped convict James Earl Ray convicted of the murder and sentenced to 99 years in prison. Ray confessed to pulling the trigger, then quickly proclaimed his innocence. Debate over the official version of events, in which authorities determined that Ray had acted alone, remained sharp. Conspiracy theories abound, with many refusing to believe how or why this unknown convict could have escaped from a Missouri state penitentiary, planned the assassination, and thwarted King's security detail all on his own. In death King became a martyr in the civil rights struggle, but in life he was a charismatic hero battling for racial equality, from the 1956 bus boycott in Montgomery, Alabama and non-violent protest marches through to his famous "I have a dream" speech in Washington in 1963. "I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: 'We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal,'" King told some 250,000 people gathered at the Lincoln Memorial in the US capital. "I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character." Four words -- "I have a dream" -- thundered through his speech and entered into the American lexicon as symbols of the pursuit of racial equality in America. Some 40 years later, Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama's campaign is putting that concept to the test. The Illinois senator -- the only African American presently in the Senate -- addressed the sensitive race issue directly in a recent speech in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, that drew parallels with King. Obama's remarks were "the most important speech on the question of race and the future of this country since Dr King's 'I have a dream' speech," said Chaka Fattah, a black Congressman from Pennsylvania. Several other commentators hailed Obama's address as historic. According to a CBS News opinion poll, 69 percent of Americans approved of the Illinois senator's speech, in which he urged an end to the country's "racial stalemate." Obama also spoke eloquently about black "anger" and white "resentment" at a time when divisive talk about race threatened to engulf the presidential campaign. "I have never been so naive as to believe that we can get beyond our racial divisions in a single election cycle," Obama said. "But I have asserted a firm conviction ... that working together we can move beyond some of our old racial wounds," said Obama. While 52 percent of Americans hailed King's "great influence" on civil rights -- with 75 percent of blacks and 47 percent of whites saying so -- some 39 percent of blacks said the country still had "a long way to go" towards racial equality, according to a survey of 1,012 respondents conducted by Ohio University. Throughout the country, religious ceremonies and university conferences will celebrate King's legacy, including an event at Tennessee's Vanderbilt University, where longtime human rights advocate and black activist Angela Davis will address the theme "We are not now living the dream" of Martin Luther King. (The report appeared on newsinfo.inquirer.net) --------------------- Forty years on, Obama, others still stand in King's shadow By John Railey By the spring of 1968, an exhausted Martin King was often tortured by thoughts that he would be killed. He harnessed his pain and pressed on. “He grasped the benefit of dramatizing his fight with death - and hence, his people’s fight with social death as victims of oppression,” Michael Eric Dyson writes in his compelling new book, April 4, 1968: Martin Luther King Jr.’s Death and How It Changed America. “King never tired of telling black folk that unearned suffering, even death, is redemptive. … What we make of his death may determine what we make of his legacy and our future.” Friday will mark the 40th anniversary of King’s assassination on that Memphis hotel balcony. The anniversary has always been a more realistic occasion than the King holiday in January. The holiday is about sweet dreams. The anniversary is about whether America really is moving from nightmares to those dreams. This year, in addition to the big 4-0 number, Barack Obama’s presidential run has given us all the more reason to ponder that question. Obama, with his mix of black blood and white blood, has forced America into a debate on race. But it’s a debate that often gets dumbed down, just as King’s radical dreams of peace, equality and justice have been dumbed down. King’s hard legacy was quickly wrapped in soft myth. “Before his body was even laid to rest, Martin Luther King Jr. had slipped into the long night of myth,” Dyson writes. “He quickly became the most overworked martyr since Abraham Lincoln.” And “martyrdom also forced onto King’s dead body the face of a toothless tiger. … In exchange for collective guilt, whites have given King lesser victories: a national birthday, iconic ubiquity, and endless encomiums,” Dyson, who is black, writes. “But blacks have not been innocent in the posthumous manipulations of King’s legacy. If whites have undercut King by praising him to death, blacks have hollowed his humanity through worship. … Whites want him clawless; blacks want him flawless.” Amen. Dyson writes about how Jesse Jackson and Al Sharpton, despite what Dyson depicts as strong efforts, have failed to fully carry out King’s dreams. You think? Dyson could have found a few other black leaders to explore. Regardless of what their inflated egos might lead them to believe, Jackson and Sharpton don’t speak for all black folks any more than James Dobson and Pat Robertson speak for all white folks. Dyson writes that because “King and Jackson fought bitter battles with ugly forces, Obama can gracefully walk through doors kicked in by King and Jackson.” Jackson did fight those battles, at least in his days as one of King’s lieutenants. But Sharpton’s fighting, often just for the sake of publicity, has accomplished little except to further divide the races. And how about all the anonymous blacks and whites who paved the way for Obama’s presidential run? Dyson does seem to get that point. “As he walks through those doors, Obama carries the legacy of his people even as he seeks to serve the entire nation. There could hardly be a more fitting tribute to King, and to the people and justice he loved.” It’s a grand vision, anyway, that suggestion that Obama could sweep into the White House, buoyed in large part on the dreams of another charismatic black leader. For Obama to have made it as far as he has is a huge statement in and of itself about how far we’ve all come. And regardless of whether we’re backing Obama, we can all hope that 40 years after King’s assassination, a black leader shouldn’t have to worry whether he’ll have all the time he needs to play out his hand, for better or worse. He shouldn’t have to worry that he’ll be killed for the color of his skin in a land that proclaims freedom for all. (The article appeared on www.journalnow.com)

description: Actually, the right title would be "unplugged" but I already drew a picture by that title + this meant something completelly different. I will stay more abstract in this comment. This picture was drawn for a heartbroken person. But I really fail to cheer up people. Ok, that was too sarcastic. Of course this is not a cheer up! picture. It's about that drowning, free falling, icecold, desperate drop when people vanish that are dear and important to you. And there is no turning back. If one doesn't break free on own accords, there is this spiraling down and turning numb of cold and becomming empty. Of course, there also is a lot of Bosch-Reference, due to the nightmarish world that goes on in the first breath of emotional war... but turns cold as well. The last valentine's card I drew was way more happy but strangely, very, very close to this one. I just realized that. description: When I saw this fav.me/dbsk858 by hodarinundu.deviantart.com/ I just had to do one myself! Frill sharks are primitive sharks, living fossils and only rarely encountered in the wild, as they live in deeper waters and rarely surface.

description: Acrylic paint on acrylic paper Several hours I think it would be really neat to get to know him. Maybe we could be friends. I painted about 5 backgrounds before I settled on this one. I painted for the first time in a while, which felt good, especially since I didn't trace or draw with pencils before painting. I just jumped in and I think it's alright. I used some stills from the Doctor Who episode "Vincent and the Doctor" and some of van Gogh's own paintings as reference. I kind of wanted to make his face more gaunt, but that's okay. "If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced." Available as a print

description: Traditional drawing of cherries (or: a little traditional still life for practicing)! I hope you like it! I took a photo of this drawing and included some colored pencils, because of the upcoming new thumbnail grid (no titles below the thumbnails... pretty bad especially for realism if you ask me ). Beta testers (like me, because I just wanted to get a star next to my name instead of that strange lettering) can already see the new grid in a few parts of the site, by the way. I like the new grid, but the missing title which you only see when hovering over a thumbnail and a few other small issues still bug me. For me a title can sometimes be a really important part of the artwork. Reference (stock) photo by NellyGraceNG : Cherries 01 Paper DIN A4 190g/m²; Faber-Castell Polychromos artists' colour pencils, Copic Ciao and Sketch marker, uni-ball Signo pigment ink um-153 white; time: 5,5 hours Please don't upload my pictures somewhere else without my permission. description: 18x24 Arches hot press paper Watercolours and Masquepen supernib 50 days, approximately 230 hours Closeup I ; Closeup II Work-in-progress shots Click to view first concept from June 2008 Click to view second concept from July 2009 ????????????????? When I turn to look, the flowers had all fallen away It has been more than a year since my father passed away, and my grief has shifted to a new realm. Much to my surprise, a piece that I thought I would never revisit was actually calling for me to give it the attention it deserves. The initial shock has passed; the briefest wash of understanding keeps coming and going. "There is probably no more terrible instant of enlightenment than the one in which you discover your father is a man - with human flesh. " - Frank Herbert, Dune I owe so much to my husband `zerocomplex for the completion of this painting. Also, thank you my dear friends ^sphilr, `johnpaulthornton, *lolitaAgogo, `JurgenDoe and `synconi for taking an interest in the work-in-progress. Thank you for looking . . : : katherine-cheng.com : : . .

description: First there were her eyes, eyes surrounded with a pure, indolent face. Things started to swirl around. A miscellany of intricate organic and mechanic pipes and wires filled up the space between us, and i forgot about everything. I even forgot about gravity. But still...there were her eyes, pure, indolent in the middle of technical nonsense. ----- This drawing was initialy a sketch on a thin draft paper (A4 size), but i finally made it a finished artwork. I was almost not allowed to rub out because of the bad quality of the medium, so there are still errors that i can´t touch up anymore (like with the right hand).

description: "Good to till the last drop" Originally established in "Mill-e-wah-kay" Wisconsin, this once popular (now popular again) taste of the gods is now brewed in Woodridge, Illinois. Originally called, "BEST SELECT", this was my Grandma's favorite beer. "America's Best" from the WORLDS COLUMBIAN EXPOSITION, is an award the seems to be that of urban legend. PBR me ASAP! Fun Facts: -Peak sales of PBR were in 1977, with 18 million barrels being produced. That number dropped to below a million by the time 2001 rolled around. -The popularity began to rise again in cities like Chicago, Philadelphia, and Portland in early 2005, thanks to the hipsters. -"Heineken? Fuck that shit! Pabst Blue Ribbon!" quote from Frank Booth (Played by Dennis Hopper) in the movie "Blue Velvet" -"Rednecks, White socks, and Pabst Blue Ribbon", referral of a 1973 song by country artist, Johnny Russel Submission for the PBR art show in minneapolis 2010 10 x 17 on cold press watercolor - pen and ink - Pastel markers - graphite

description: EDIT : Here is a higher scan version which will allow prints for ! Long time I didn't post something. Less time, much work. Another dragon for the book project, wanted to done a black dragon with some cliché, evil, on skulls, blood and bad breathe. (Sexy, isn't it ?) But in fact, it's a lovely dragon, who just want to eat cookies. Love for black dragons ! COMMENTS PLEASE !! Medium : Coffee/Pigments/Inks FAQ : What is O Ka-Fée ? O Ka-Fée is the term concerning all my paintings done with coffee. It concerns the way of painting and of obtaining textures with coffee. It's about projections of coffee, which once in stains on the sheet, undergo injections of pigments. (Powder, colorex, watercolor.) Textures realized by coffee by drying (more or less sweetened) are unique, they are more interesting than those realized with water. The coffee is a rather complex medium has to master, it's necessary to know its reactions to be able to manipulate it with pigments, we learn it every day. O Ka-Fée also concern my graphic style and the whole universe which gets free of it. It's for that the term is my own brand. Please, respect my universe and work. / Version FR FAQ : Qu'est ce que O Ka-Fée ? O Ka-Fée est le terme concernant mes peintures réalisées avec pour base de café. Il s'agit de la manière de peindre et d'obtenir des textures réalisées par le café. Dans un premier temps ce sont des projections de café dans lesquelles ensuite on injecte des pigments. (Poudres, colorex, aquarelle.) Les textures réalisées par le café (plus ou moins sucré et selon la marque.) sont uniques, elles sont plus fortes et intéressantes que celles réalisées avec l'eau. Le café est un médium complexe a maitriser, il est important de connaître ses réactions afin de les manipuler avec les pigments, on en apprend tous les jours de part ce médium. O Ka-Fée concerne aussi mon univers et style graphique, ce sont souvent des peintures et univers libres, avec du mouvement et de la poésie. Merci de respecter mon travail et univers. - More O Ka-Fée art from my Book project :

description: This is my entry for the "Psychedelic Treasures" club's contest to make something to use as a webcam picture or ID psychedelictreasures.deviantar… ! So I thought I'd go all out with the colours. This contest was perfect for me because i was aching to do something really colourful after a run of black and white..ish ones. Looking for inspiration I started listening to music. After going through my most psychedelic stuff I put on a song I listen to pretty much daily and thought "hey! this song is pretty grand and colourful and sunny and works well with what I've got" (those were the criteria lol). The song was "Luv Your Life" by Silverchair and i was going to call it that but changed my mind.. If you've ever seen the video clip for it you could tell i drew inspiration from that. I knew the style that i wanted the psychedelic stuff to be in but had no idea what it was going to be or how it would fit in a picture. So I came up with the old gramophone and then everything fell into place. I went the surreal/cartoony way after originally intending it to be more realistic. I just love the idea of this absolutely massive gramophone on the top of the greenest hill, surrounded by the other greenest hills, in the middle of nowhere, in the late afternoon sun...doing this lol. How cool would it be to see it!! oh the scale (its probably not easy to tell) : i tried to make it as though a tree would be halfway between the base and the actual record.. Damn scanners and their grainy translations of coloured pencil haha. But Im pretty proud of how it ended up. Hope this makes up for how long i take between submitting stuff. -------------------------------- Follow me on Facebook for a more "compelling and rich" (Burgundy 2004) Simanion experience: www.facebook.com/simanion Share "The Sounds of Escapism" on Facebook: www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbi… Reblog "The Sounds of Escapism" on Tumblr: simanion.tumblr.com/post/15901…

description: Medium: Ink (Copic Multiliners 0.1, 0.05), watercolour, coffeeSize: A2 Finally done! This work was a commission for a friend, whose only direction was "your version of a world map". Initially I was planning a more abstract painting or drawing. But I really love ancient and medieval maps, the way they were so impossibly detailed and whimsical, often with huge sections of the world remaining mysteriously uncharted. I did a lot of research, looking at what must have been hundreds of examples, all wildly different. I actually went to an exhibition of some of the world's greatest maps and was truly inspired there. What fascinated me most were the bizarre mythological creatures conveniently slotted into the unexplored waters, as well as the sometimes absurd surrounding detail and the "almost but not quite" shapes of the countries. They were generally pretty eccentric – much more interesting than our boring contemporary maps. So I took all that away, and started thinking about mine. Because I could never just do a straightforward map, I decided to contextualize mine within a kind of hypothetical alternate history. I invented a language that seems to sit somewhere between Tolkien, Shaun Tan and astrological symbols. Unfortunately I don't have the skill to translate it. The idea was that this map was produced by an ancient extraterrestrial race with esoteric knowledge of the planets and stars. Perhaps they arrived on Earth travelling between dimensions, mapped what they saw and then left before they were able to finish. I spent approximately 4 hours a day for a month on this map. I certainly didn't take the easy road and so it owned my life. But I'm really happy with how it turned out Hopefully it translates on screen. ~Simon Follow my page on Facebook: facebook.com/simanion Instagram @ simanion

description: You know how I said I won't get sidetracked by Project WE until I finish the wolves and commission? Well *cough* I lied D: I'm sorry =_= Oh, there is one thing about this project that I can tell you. When it's all nice and done in a few years, it'll be free for public viewing. You won't have to buy it or anything. Other Project WE sketches: [link] The answer to the chosen question is: 5. Project WE is not about romance. The old answers were: 1. It's not about vampires 2. There are no zombies either 3. Not even cannibals 4. I did not base the blue eyed character off of me, my friends, or you If you have a question about the secret Project WE, ask and I might just answer. But they must be questions like "is this about demons?" or "will there be magic?", and not questions like "what is this about?" or "What is the name of the character." Basically, they must be yes or no questions. I will only answer one question for every new post, and the answer will be a "no" like "no, there is no demons, etc" If I didn't choose to answer your question, that might either mean the answer is a yes, or your question didn't get picked hahaha, I'm keeping things ambiguous. So ask away and the one new answer will be revealed in the next post.

description: . This is the apartment of Dexter Morgan from the series "DEXTER". . Note 1: The biggest problem with this design has been the bathroom. The whole set of Dexter (both inside and outside) was built entirely on a soundstage from the first episode. However the bathroom never appeared except in the eposide in wich Dexter climbs to the window of the bathroom to enter in his house. But in this sequence only this window and a part of the bathtub was shown. In the beginning of the 6th season the bathroom appears a little bit more (when Dexter gives a bath to his child) but nor completely. And in fact the modification of the apartment (adding an entry to the other apartment) has changed the shape of this zone. I based the bathroom in this image: i49.tinypic.com/f2olv.jpg This is a production piture of the set as it was designed and constructed from the beggining but never used completely. Note 2: If you see the exterior of the real apartment (in 1155-103rd Street - Bay Harbor Islands - Miami) you can count 4 glass "segments" to the right of the entry door. But if you see the series or a picture of the exterior set built in the soundstage you can count 5 segments. i50.tinypic.com/2w7hncl.jpg The designer probably make this change to make a bigger interior. And I drawn the floorplan with this proportions. . Some sets have changed throughout the different seasons and this floorplan is a mixture of various of them. This is a hand drawed plan, in scale, coloured with colour pencils and with full details of furniture, fabric, timbers and complements… The design is made according with the “real” apartment respecting the spaces, proportions, furniture and objets presents in the studio set. . If you want to buy an original drawing, especially handmade for you, contact me at ializar@hotmail.com or visit my ETSY store: www.etsy.com/shop/TVFLOORPLANS… .

description: There is a tale about a lovely seal that shed her skin as she came upon the shore. She transformed into a beautiful woman and became a delight to the eyes of fishermen in those parts. One day a man took her seal skin as she was bathing in the shallow waters and she soon became the wife of the lonely fisherman. She spent her days as a good and loyal companion to the man until one day she found her skin and she returned to the sea as seal once again. For this was her destiny, to fill the heart of a lonely man with love and service until she was called back to the sea. This original was created using watercolors on Arches 140lb cold press paper. It measures 5 1/2 x 9 1/2 inches.

description: ...not all those who wander are lost... Especially if you have THIS map! After the hard work of a week I give you the full map of Middle Earth! See the process here: fav.me/d35p8fz 100 x 70 cm Acrylics and pens on Schoeller paper full view if you like Enjoy ------------------- the text says: The world was young, the mountains green, No stain yet on the Moon was seen, No words were laid on stream or stone, When Durin woke and walked alone. He named the nameless hills and dells; He drank from yet untasted wells; He stooped and looked in Mirrormere, And saw a crown of stars appear, As gems upon a silver thread, Above the shadow of his head. The world was fair, the mountains tall, In Elder Days before the fall Of mighty Kings in Nargothrond And Gondolin, who now beyond The Western Seas have passed away: The world was fair in Durin's Day. A king he was on carven throne In many-pillared halls of stone With golden roof and silver floor, And runes of power upon the door. The light of sun and star and moon In shining lamps of crystal hewn Undimmed by cloud or shade of night There shown forever far and bright. There hammer on the anvil smote, There chisel clove, and graver wrote; There forged was bladed and bound was hilt; The delver mined the mason built. There beryl, pearl, and opal pale And metel wrought like fishes' mail, Buckler and corslet, axe and sword, And shining spears were laid in horde. Unwearied then were Durin's folk; Beneath the mountains music woke: The harpers harped, the minstrels sang, And at the gates the trumpets rang. The world is grey, the mountains old, The forge's fire is ashen-cold; No harp is wrung, no hammer falls: The darkness dwells in Durin's halls; The shadow lies upon his tomb In Moria, in Khazad-d?m. But still the sunken stars appear In dark and windless Mirrormere; There lies his crown in water deep, Till Durin wakes again from sleep. (Song of Durin's Awakening by JRR Tolkien) EDIT: I've uploaded a better res foto of the map

description: After I completed Sisters of the Sky, I realized that I had Sisters of the Sun and did not have Sisters of the Moon. Since there was a cat for the sun picture, I figured that it would be appropriate to use a wolf for the moon. The figure's face I tried to keep in half shadow, reminiscent of the moon itself. Also I liked the fact that the moon is supposed to represent the female qualities along with hidden traits. The water being dark, reflective, and hidden, with only a few reflecting lights, was much like the night sky itself with the female representation of the moon standing within it. This is a combined media project of watercolor and digital, as you can tell by the moon and stars. Most of it is watercolor, but I discovered that you could print out base colors onto watercolor paper, so I printed out the moon too. After scanning it I enhanced it a bit more in photoshop with the stars and such. Unfortunately the conversion from tiff to jpg made the colors darker and dingier than I wanted. For reference I used a photo of a dear friend and model from my own stock on LinzStock I figure if I'm going to ask others to follow the rules, then I should too

description: I got inspired by the My Dying Bride song "For My Fallen Angel" That song makes me cry..it's so sad..... Tools: Acrylics, Watercolor Pencils, Ink. "As I draw up my breath, And silver fills my eyes. I kiss her still, For she will never rise. On my weak body, Lays her dying hand. Through those meadows of Heaven, Where we ran. Like a thief in the night, The wind blows so light. It wars with my tears, That won't dry for many years. "Loves golden arrow At her should have fled, And not Deaths ebon dart To strike her dead." -My Dying Bride

description: The Queen of Technical Nonsense I drew her eyes 3 years ago and swirled around them in a abstract fever whose meaning I never really understood. Each time I entered my parent's home I was captivated by her look from the other side of the corridor. I always wondered what unspoken thought could hide behind her pale forehead, what mysterious secret could drive me hypnotized to the depths of her pupils. One day at in a sudden impulse I grabbed a random blank canvas and started to sketch my Queen again. I painted during one month. Feverishly. I struggled with the hues to keep her face cold but still feel the life breathing underneath. I blew wind in her hair and colored her lips with purple. I spent tenth of hours with tiny brushes to carve the surface of her mechaorganic coat. I reworked her eyes several times until I felt trapped in her look again. But I still wonder so many things about her. Close-ups here Reference drawing here Related scrap here *edit* I was much pleasantly surprised this morning to find out my Queen had been featured as a daily deviation. She told me that she felt really honored by such a great distinction. Allow me to transmit her words of thankfulness to all of you.

description: Gouache on black cardboard with a coat of red under the colours. I couldn't sleep so I painted this. I guess the symmetry is me trying to find some order in shapes when the colours clearly left out of my hands to rainbow land. Somehow I was able to sleep right after I had finished this. It felt like the painting was so anxious to get out on the paper it couldn't wait until I had rested a bit first I usually post work in progress shots and making of videos on my angrymikko instagram account www.instagram.com/angrymikko/ in stories if anyone is interested in that sort of stuff. They're not like finely produced or anything that's why I don't put them on DA because they would just bloat up your feeds =/ Anyway thanks for stopping by I hope this brings a pinch of colour to your winter days too

description: one of the lesser known south american theropods, piatnitzkysaurus, like opistocoelicaudia is one of those dinosaurs that has quite a mouthful of a name. The animals lived in the middle jurassic and while it has often simply been called a basaö tetanuran, it is now classified as a megalosauroid . As such it had the classical bodyplan of a theropod:bipedal, 3fingered forearms, a large head with sharp teeth and along tail.

description: Haven't worked with colored pencils in ages! It was fun XP About the title: "Marisopa" is a misspeling of "Mariposa", which means "butterfly" in spanish. The girl in the picture (original char of mine) is named Marisopa. My first language is Spanish, btw... Taisho is a japanese era from 1912 to 1926. There is an art style from around that period called "Taisho Romantic" or "Taisho Roman". Kimonos with Taisho Roman patterns are very colorful and pretty, and a couple fo them inspired the patterns on this picture :3 Hope you like it Original size: 8,5x11 - ish Tools: old scrap piece of Opaline paper, Faber-castell Polychromos Colors on the picture are more vivid than the original. The bg on paper is so desaturated it's almost gray in reality xD; You can see a couple of WIP pictures here: deji.ishtera.net/blog/?p=1550

I used colored pencil over the darker marker to make the wings stand out. I made sure to texture the wings. Hope that helps a little to explain what I did in case you'd like to experiment with it yourself. Work in progress: pegacorna2.deviantart.com/art/… This unicorn and dragon are beings that are very precious to me. This picture was drawn as a Valentines Day present to my boyfriend Arlon. This is the color scheme I designed for a sculpture I am having made for him. Almalphia is the person I have commissioned.
